description: From Middle English dangerous (“difficult, severe, domineering, arrogant, fraught with danger”), daungerous, from Anglo-Norman [Term?], from Old French dangereus (“threatening, difficult”), from dangier. Equivalent to danger +‎ -ous.

adjectives.description: dangerous (comparative more dangerous, superlative most dangerous)

examples: Railway crossings without gates are highly dangerous.
Synonyms: hazardous, perilous, risky, unsafe; see also Thesaurus:dangerous

entries.meaning: Causing danger; ready to do harm or injury.
(colloquial, dated) In a condition of danger, as from illness; threatened with death.
